required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Telotristat Etiprate (LX1606) in Participants With Symptomatic Carcinoid Syndrome Not Managed by Stable-Dose Octreotide Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 2, Multicenter, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled, Ascending, Multidose Study To Determine Safety and Tolerability of Orally Administered LX1606 in Subjects With Symptomatic Carcinoid Syndrome Refractory to Stable-Dose Octreotide Long-Acting Release Depot Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and tolerability of telotristat etiprate (LX1606) versus a placebo control in participants with symptomatic carcinoid syndrome not managed by stable-dose long-acting octreotide therapy. Following determination of the maximally tolerated or effective dose, cohort expansion will occur to confirm effect on symptoms and safety profile.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) and Any Drug-related TEAE in the Core Phase
primary_outcome.description: An adverse event (AE) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug-related. A TEAE was an AE reported after the first dose of randomized treatment on Day 1.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Any TEAE in the Open-Label Extension Phase
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 180 weeks in the open-label extension phase
primary_outcome.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. A TEAE was an AE reported after receiving treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Mean Number of Bowel Movements (BMs) Per Day
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the number of BMs per day in a daily diary. The total number of BMs per day were averaged over the 4-week period. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Weekly Mean Stool Form
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded stool form in a daily diary using a 6-point scale (0-none,1-hard, 2-firm, 3-soft, 4-loose, 5-watery). A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Percentage of Days Per Week Experiencing a Sensation of Urgency to Defecate
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the sensation of urgency to defecate (Yes or No) in a daily diary. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Number of Cutaneous Flushing Episodes
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the number of daily flushing episodes per day in a daily diary. The total number of flushing episodes per day were averaged over the 4-week period. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Severity of Abdominal Pain or Discomfort
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded the severity of abdominal pain or discomfort in a daily diary assessed using a 4-point scale (0-none, 1-mild, 2-moderate, 3-severe). A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Urinary 5-hydroxyindoleacetic Acid (u5-HIAA)
secondary_outcome.description: u5-HIAA is a standard test used in clinical practice to assess the neuroendocrine tumor (NET) activity and is collected as a 24-hour urine specimen. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Chromogranin A
secondary_outcome.description: Blood samples were collected for assessment of Chromogranin A level. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Reporting Improvement in the Subjective Global Assessment of Symptoms Associated With Carcinoid Syndrome
secondary_outcome.description: Participants were asked to answer the following question: "In the past 7 days, have you had adequate relief of your carcinoid syndrome bowel complaints such as diarrhea, urgent need to have a bowel movement, abdominal pain, or discomfort?". The number of participants who answered Yes are reported.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Frequency of Rescue for Short-acting Octreotide Use/Day
secondary_outcome.description: Participants recorded details (location and frequency of injection) of subcutaneous injections of rescue, short-acting octreotide, if taken, in the daily diary. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to First Rescue, Short-acting Octreotide
secondary_outcome.description: Time to the first subcutaneous injections of rescue, short-acting octreotide was determined from the participant's daily diary.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Experiencing Complete Response at Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Complete Response to treatment was defined as one of the following: 1. Less than 4 bowel movements per day; or 2. A decrease in daily bowel movements that is ≥ 50% from baseline; or 3. A positive response to the global assessment question ("In the past 7 days, have you had adequate relief of your carcinoid syndrome bowel complaints such as diarrhea, urgent need to have a bowel movement, abdominal pain or discomfort?") for each of the last 2 weeks of the Treatment Period.

arm_group.description: Telotristat etiprate capsules,150 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period (core phase) in combination with stable-dose octreotide long-acting release (LAR) depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

Telotristat etiprate capsules, 250 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

Telotristat etiprate capsules, 350 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

Telotristat etiprate capsules, 500 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with a stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

Placebo-matching telotristat etiprate capsules, orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to receive telotristat etiprate in the optional open-label extension period.

Telotristat etiprate at assigned dose level for 8 weeks in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month in the open-label extension period. Upon completion of the 8-week period, participants could enter an additional extension period of 172 weeks, receiving telotristat etiprate at the assigned dose or maximum tolerated dose (500 mg 3 times daily).

intervention.description: Telotristat etiprate capsules; orally 3 times daily.
A stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy; administered subcutaneously once per month.
Placebo-matching telotristat etiprate capsules; orally 3 times daily.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Males and females, aged 18 and older
- Biopsy-proven metastatic carcinoid tumor of the gastrointestinal (GI) tract with disease extent confirmed by computed tomography (CT), magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), or radionuclide imaging
- Symptoms not managed by stable-dose long-acting octreotide therapy (≥4 bowel movements per day)
- Ability to provide written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- ≥12 high volume, watery bowel movements per day associated with a clinical syndrome of volume contraction, dehydration, or hypotension compatible with a "pancreatic cholera"-type clinical syndrome
- Sponsor-unacceptable clinical laboratory values for hematology and liver function tests at screening
- Karnofsky status ≤70% - unable to care for self
- Surgery within 60 days prior to screening
- A history of short bowel syndrome
- Life expectancy <12 months
- History of substance or alcohol abuse within 2 years prior to screening
- Previous exposure to a tryptophan hydroxylase (TPH) inhibitor
- Administration of any investigational drug within 30 days of screening or any therapeutic protein or antibody within 90 days of screening

facility.name: UCSF Helen Diller Family Comprehensive Cancer Center
St. Francis Medical Group Oncology and Hematology Specialists

participant_flow.recruitment_details: A total of 23 participants were enrolled in the Core Phase (ie, Screening and Double-blind Treatment Period) from 11 sites, including 1 satellite site, in the United States. 19 participants entered the Open-label Extension Phase.

group.title: Placebo Core Phase
group.description: Participants received placebo-matching telotristat etiprate capsules, orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period (core phase) in combination with stable-dose octreotide long-acting release (LAR) depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to receive telotristat etiprate in the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 150 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules,150 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 250 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules, 250 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 350 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules, 350 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 500 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules, 500 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with a stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate Open-Label Extension Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate at assigned dose level for 8 weeks in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month in the open-label extension period. Upon completion of the 8-week period, participants could enter an additional extension period of 172 weeks, receiving telotristat etiprate at the assigned dose or maximum tolerated dose (500 mg 3 times daily).

participants_list.participants: 19 of the 22 participants who completed the Core Phase entered the optional Open-Label Extension.

baseline.population: The Safety Set, Core Phase included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Any Treatment-emergent Adverse Event (TEAE) and Any Drug-related TEAE in the Core Phase
measure.description: An adverse event (AE) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug-related. A TEAE was an AE reported after the first dose of randomized treatment on Day 1.
measure.population: The Safety Set Core Phase included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug in the core phase.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Any TEAE in the Open-Label Extension Phase
outcome.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. A TEAE was an AE reported after receiving treatment.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 180 weeks in the open-label extension phase
outcome.population: The Safety Set Extension Period included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug in the open-label extensions phase.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate Open-Label Extension Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate at assigned dose level for 8 weeks in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month in the open-label extension period. Upon completion of the 8-week period, participants could enter an additional extension period of 172 weeks, receiving telotristat etiprate at the assigned dose or maximum tolerated dose (500 mg 3 times daily).

measure.title: Number of Participants With Any TEAE in the Open-Label Extension Phase
measure.description: An AE was defined as any untoward medical occurrence associated with the use of a drug in humans, whether or not considered drug related. A TEAE was an AE reported after receiving treatment.
measure.population: The Safety Set Extension Period included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug in the open-label extensions phase.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Mean Number of Bowel Movements (BMs) Per Day
outcome.description: Participants recorded the number of BMs per day in a daily diary. The total number of BMs per day were averaged over the 4-week period. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants from the modified Intent to Treat (mITT) Set, Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug, with data available for analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Urinary 5-hydroxyindoleacetic Acid (u5-HIAA)
outcome.description: u5-HIAA is a standard test used in clinical practice to assess the neuroendocrine tumor (NET) activity and is collected as a 24-hour urine specimen. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants from the Pharmacodynamic (PD) Analysis Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had a valid Baseline and at least 1 valid post-Baseline PD assessment, with data available for analysis.

group.title: Placebo Core Phase
group.description: Participants received placebo-matching telotristat etiprate capsules, orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period (core phase) in combination with stable-dose octreotide long-acting release (LAR) depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to receive telotristat etiprate in the optional open-label extension period.

group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules,150 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. measure.title: Change From Baseline in Urinary 5-hydroxyindoleacetic Acid (u5-HIAA)
measure.description: u5-HIAA is a standard test used in clinical practice to assess the neuroendocrine tumor (NET) activity and is collected as a 24-hour urine specimen. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Participants from the Pharmacodynamic (PD) Analysis Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had a valid Baseline and at least 1 valid post-Baseline PD assessment, with data available for analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Chromogranin A
outcome.description: Blood samples were collected for assessment of Chromogranin A level. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants from the mITT Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug, with data available for analysis.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Chromogranin A
measure.description: Blood samples were collected for assessment of Chromogranin A level. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
measure.population: Participants from the mITT Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug, with data available for analysis.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Reporting Improvement in the Subjective Global Assessment of Symptoms Associated With Carcinoid Syndrome
outcome.description: Participants were asked to answer the following question: "In the past 7 days, have you had adequate relief of your carcinoid syndrome bowel complaints such as diarrhea, urgent need to have a bowel movement, abdominal pain, or discomfort?". The number of participants who answered Yes are reported.
outcome.population: Participants from the mITT Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug, with data available for analysis.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Frequency of Rescue for Short-acting Octreotide Use/Day
outcome.description: Participants recorded details (location and frequency of injection) of subcutaneous injections of rescue, short-acting octreotide, if taken, in the daily diary. A negative change from Baseline indicates improvement.
outcome.population: Participants from the mITT Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug, with data available for analysis.

outcome.title: Time to First Rescue, Short-acting Octreotide
outcome.description: Time to the first subcutaneous injections of rescue, short-acting octreotide was determined from the participant's daily diary.
outcome.population: Participants from the mITT Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug, As per protocol only the Placebo Core Phase and Telotristat Etiprate 500 mg Core Phase were included in the analysis.

group.title: Placebo Core Phase
group.description: Participants received placebo-matching telotristat etiprate capsules, orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period (core phase) in combination with stable-dose octreotide long-acting release (LAR) depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to receive telotristat etiprate in the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 500 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules, 500 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with a stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

measure.title: Time to First Rescue, Short-acting Octreotide
measure.description: Time to the first subcutaneous injections of rescue, short-acting octreotide was determined from the participant's daily diary.
measure.population: Participants from the mITT Set Core Phase, all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug, As per protocol only the Placebo Core Phase and Telotristat Etiprate 500 mg Core Phase were included in the analysis.

measurement_list.measurement: The upper limit of 95% Confidence Interval was not obtained due to the low number of participants with events.
The upper limit of 95% Confidence Interval was not obtained due to the low number of participants with events.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Experiencing Complete Response at Week 4
outcome.description: Complete Response to treatment was defined as one of the following: 1. Less than 4 bowel movements per day; or 2. A decrease in daily bowel movements that is ≥ 50% from baseline; or 3. A positive response to the global assessment question ("In the past 7 days, have you had adequate relief of your carcinoid syndrome bowel complaints such as diarrhea, urgent need to have a bowel movement, abdominal pain or discomfort?") for each of the last 2 weeks of the Treatment Period.
outcome.population: The mITT Set Core Phase included all participants who received any fraction of a dose of study drug and had at least 1 week of data recorded in the daily diary after receiving study drug.

Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to receive telotristat etiprate in the optional open-label extension period.

A decrease in daily bowel movements that is ≥ 50% from baseline; or 3. A positive response to the global assessment question ("In the past 7 days, have you had adequate relief of your carcinoid syndrome bowel complaints such as diarrhea, urgent need to have a bowel movement, abdominal pain or discomfort?") for each of the last 2 weeks of the Treatment Period.

reported_events.time_frame: Adverse event data was collected during the core phase over 4 weeks and up to 180 weeks in the extension phase
reported_events.desc: Safety Set included all participants who received at least one dose of study drug.

group.title: Placebo Core Phase
group.description: Participants received placebo-matching telotristat etiprate capsules, orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period (core phase) in combination with stable-dose octreotide long-acting release (LAR) depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to receive telotristat etiprate in the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 150 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules,150 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 250 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules, 250 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 350 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules, 350 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate 500 mg Core Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate capsules, 500 mg orally 3 times daily for 28 days in the double-blind treatment period in combination with a stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month. Upon completion of 28-days of treatment, participants were eligible to enter the optional open-label extension period.

group.title: Telotristat Etiprate Open-Label Extension Phase
group.description: Participants received telotristat etiprate at assigned dose level for 8 weeks in combination with stable-dose octreotide LAR depot therapy given once per month in the open-label extension period. Upon completion of the 8-week period, participants could enter an additional extension period of 172 weeks, receiving telotristat etiprate at the assigned dose or maximum tolerated dose (500 mg 3 times daily).

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Institution must provide any proposed publication or presentation to Sponsor for Sponsor's review, comment and approval at least thirty (30) days prior to the proposed submission for publication date or the proposed presentation date. Sponsor shall have the right to have deleted from the final version of the publication any confidential information, proprietary information, or patentable subject matter.
